title: Overview of Science Research in Moldova

author: Ion Tighineanu, Academy of Sciences of the Republic of Moldova

segmentation: So good evening and gentlemen, I first I would like to think the world is there to international Centers for inviting me to return this interesting meeting and also to thank hosts.
Our hosts know Ben host for the very good organization at this event.
I will speak about so research in Moldova and I would like to.
The draw your attention.
Moldova is small country coming from the former Soviet Union.
You see map actually.
So we have about four millions people and the territory is about 33,000 square kilometers.
Their capital is occasional Russian kitchen of then so well behaved.
Moldova is was well known in the Soviet Union as binary it was.
Why not have the Soviet Union?
We have some villages, let's say underground that huge caves underground and we have real Maps of this caves and there are some well known in Europe.
A village is like click over.
Some of you probably know and weather and less team each and others maliciously.
Meteor actually is in the genius book, so these are huge caves, underground, interpenetrating, and it's probably possible to drive a car well, and we store their wine becausw around the year.
Temperature is the same 11 degrees South.
So, and it's a huge air conditions to so cheap there wines well, but not tend to research.
So here you see the main building over the Sciences of Moldova.
Well, speaking about research I would like to note that after the the Soviet Union in Moldova first industry collapse because it was in the Soviet Union, integrated in the so.
Body and due to this also of course the reception well started to go down and.
Here you can see that the number over a researchers, so they have there.
So you know, scientific institutions more than, let's say twenty 2000s.

But if we speak about worker institutions related to research and development, there 33 thousands of researchers now we have so more than 2000 scientific resources in the Academy of Sciences and more than 2000 in universities and other Research Institute, so that.
Research institutes belonging to the ministry.
So in 2003 there were discussions.
What actually should we do with with the Academy of Sciences becausw?
Yeah, so it was clear that it was not efficient and so that the after many discussions and initiated by the current President of the Academy of Sciences or Moldova, Tucker.
After many discussions, the decision was two.
Regenerated the Academy.
And so, in 2004, the new law in science and innovation, so ratified by the Parliament, it was in July 2004, and so from this July 2000.
Fortunately reforms in research and innovation here in Moldova started.
And I would like to note that there Academy nowadays is like a ministry is actually a real Minister of science and technological development.

The president of the Academy of Sciences of Moldova is a member of the Cabinet of Ministers and that's very important because in this case we have real possibilities to influence the decisions made by government.
We have real.

The possibilities to convince the government the power to to allocate finance for the science and also I would like to mention that the Academy of Sciences or Moldova so is responsible for the scientific research and technological development in the whole country.
It doesn't matter where the operatory is placed in the University.
You know you Institute will belonging to a concrete ministry, and so the so the management of Sciences in in the hands of the Academy of Sciences.
Because we have some rather pronounced autonomy.
But we have a partnership agreement with the government that means each four years, one in four years we assign a partnership agreement and according to this.
Agreement so that we have some priority fields.
Their government so stipulates the amount of money that will allocate to the science year by year.
Actually this year we will sign a new agreement for the years 2009 2002.

12 So you can see the time so articles of the Partnership agreement, the level of financial support is stipulated, the strategic priorities concerning the development of science and innovation, and so the reorganization of the infrastructure in the science and I.
Patient here you can see the strategic priorities that will currently are valid.
I would like to say that they include their main subjects that actually will also be in the European framework.
Programs you see here, so sustainable development, efficient use of human natural resources, biomedicine and human health, agriculture, industrial biotechnologies, nanotechnologies.
Materials and information technologies.
Innergetic security and efficiency.
Growth of the energetic.
Cool complex.
Forms in science and innovation in Moldova so.
Four years ago we had more than 100 research institutes for a small country.
There was a huge amount and actually the the number of research institutes was the same as it was in the Soviet Union.
It was clear that we should transform this system.
It was not easy, but now we have 38 research institutes we can compare now in Slovenia, Dara 15 National Research Institutes in Moldova, we have 38.
Institutes.

So in Slovenia two millions of people in Moldova, for millions of people, that means we should cut and down to 30, and indeed so we are looking for this possibility to to cut down the number of research institutes.
Instead of having a lot of them, but inefficient to have a smaller number, but efficient research institutes.
So accreditation of the research institutions.
It's also not easy, but.
So no, it's possible to get money from the budget only if you are credited.
If the Research Institute is accredited, and so the it's also important that all the money are distributed via competition.

So we promoted to some important laws, strategies and the Academy played a major role in all these developments and I would especially I would like, especially to underline the new law on technology parks and business incubators.
The last line.
So this was also approved by the Parliament in summer 2007.
And now we are creating the first technology Parsons business incubators.
It's very important that the so well there are well fiscal advantages.
Practically there projects that are accepted of course via strong competition.
The activities are free of any taxes free, practically of any taxes.
And Moreover I would like to draw your attention that we when we speak about.
There's so technology transfer that currently there is Academy pays up to 60%.
And the real sector, the companies the enterprises should pay 40% up to realize the product.
That means we are interested to push this and therefore we support financially the realization of techno.
Could you transfer projects so you can now have an idea what happened in Moldova after the collapse of the Soviet Union in 1990?
We had .73% from GDP there and actually I would like to say that Moldova at the time was Republic where the science was at a higher level.
We had a lot of plants you've union importances, so also the microelectronic plants and so on.
This year 2008 we have the same.
.74%, of course, the budgets are different, but.
Percentage is the same nevertheless, so of course the situation is improving and in a couple of years we should reach 1% I I would like to underline that 1% that comes from the budget were point 74.
That means this.
It's not that it doesn't take into account the money that comes from the real sector, however, from the real secret that the amount of support is still rather low.
Cool.
So I already mentioned that they have the scientific projects are.
Did through competition, and so you speak about different kind of projects.

So because institutional projects also by competition 315 and the number of this kind of projects that drops drops and so we have now 15 state program programs, 15 state programs, 109 projects technological transfer projects.
43 and so so first.
Two years ago, the way eat technology, technological transfer projects.

So one year ago there were 27 currently 43 projects of technological and transfer, and I would like to know that probably the number now will increase considerably due to the creation of technology parks, so we also have two kind of programs that are very.
Important one to support the purchase of the equipment and actually worth over.
One year ago NET in 2007 we allocated 1 million US dollars for 20 projects and the amount in support of this program will increase and also program to support young scientists.
Even students can now.
I mean students that are already graduated from the university's, they can apply.
And get a grant.
And actually, it's several thousand US dollars per per year.
And in case the several the young people joined the efforts, they can get the server up to 10,000 euros dollar per year.
So international projects we have 120 economical services.
It means projects from the real sector more than one.
Isn't 100 so international collaboration?
I would like just to mention that well, we have assigned.
Events with the many academies and different kind of financial structures, especially if it's successful.
The program biological program with Russian Foundation for basically search last two years successfully, where I realized 44 projects.
Joint projects with Russia and now another 42 projects will start soon.
Funded jointly by Russians.
Foundation for basic Research in Moldova.
So, but SPF in international projects, Civilization Development Foundation more than 200 several millions of dollars actually 6.5 millions of dollars over the last years.
So we try to push the participation in the framework programs.
It's not easy, of course, so we participate in different projects like Scopes.
Turn NATO into us was successful, but you know that this program finishes some some joint activities with civilian research and development Foundation for this year.
For projects so we again with the civilian research and development for foundation, there was initiation initiated the creation of some centers in priority fields and of course these centers are now.
Developed under their support of the.
Tournament.
Send so concerning is the science and technology Center of Ukraine.
So for more than 40 projects have been submitted we have 5 running projects.
20 It more projects have been accepted recently.
That means we have already 7 accepted projects.
We hope that this.
So this activity is supported by STCU.
Will develop further so well.
We also try to improve the infrastructure we built recently.
GNU library so visitors that have the possibility to to pay a visit to us probably already know about this.
So some views from the scientific laboratories.
Actually it's very important to attract young researchers and therefore we are now doing the our best to to create conditions that the young generation people.
So stay in Moldova continued activity.
Moldova, after they defend their thesis.
We also would like now to initiate the.

There to build some houses for young researchers, and of course in this case just to sign contracts with this research is that they will continue their activity in Moldova after they defend the PhD thesis.
And I would like to say that some young people already so are creating their laboratories.
Of course they go abroad server, but.
Come back after one month.

After two months there are interesting developments and we hope that the efforts that have been supported over the last years by our government and actually by international so funding institutions by our partners will so great conditions that the science in Moldova will develop on a pro.
Or basis, thank you very much for your kind kind.
